sn8.8:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery, together with a large Saṅgha of 1,250 mendicants.
sn8.8:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dharma talk about extinguishment.
sn8.8:4.3: And those mendicants were paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn8.8:4.5: “The Buddha is educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dharma talk about extinguishment.
sn8.8:4.6: And the mendicants are paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn8.8:4.7: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with appropriate verses?”
sn8.8:5.1: Then Venerable Vaṅgīsa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha, and said:
sn8.8:5.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn8.8:5.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn8.8:5.4: Then Vaṅgīsa extolled the Buddha in his presence with appropriate verses.
sn8.8:6.3: as he teaches the immaculate Dhamma,
sn8.8:6.4: extinguishment, fearing nothing from any quarter.
sn8.8:7.1: They listen to the stainless Dhamma
sn8.8:7.2: taught by the fully awakened Buddha;
sn8.8:8.3: You are like a great cloud
sn8.8:9.1: I’ve emerged from my day’s meditation,
sn8.8:9.2: out of desire to see the teacher.
sn8.8:10.1: “Vaṅgīsa, had you previously composed these verses, or did they spontaneously occur to you in the moment?”
sn8.8:10.2: “They spontaneously occurred to me in the moment, sir.”
sn8.8:10.3: “Well then, Vaṅgīsa, speak some more spontaneously inspired verses.”
sn8.8:10.4: “Yes, sir,” replied Vaṅgīsa. Then he extolled the Buddha with some more spontaneously inspired verses, not previously composed.

sn8.8:13.1: The bringer of light who has pierced the truth,
sn8.8:13.2: you’ve seen what lies beyond all states of rebirth.
sn8.8:13.3: When you saw and realized this for yourself,
sn8.8:13.4: you taught it first to the group of five.
sn8.8:14.1: When the Dhamma has been so well taught,
